content.description: Stand start with your choice of edge. From there, climb straight up through an assortment of features to reach an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pad. The landing is perfect.
content.location: It climbs the northeast slab on Outback.

content.description:
Tall Drink of Water climbs a disjointed, patchwork of overhanging solid rock, via enjoyable movement, over a perfect landing.

Sit start with a right hand sloper-edge in the seam and a left hand two-finger-pocket. From there, follow the seam up and left to its terminus, then follow the arete back to the right, via thin footwork. Continue along the arete to a good edge, bring the feet along, and match a left hand bump next to the right hand. Then make a balanced reach to a pinch-edge at the lip, follow to a left hand jug, and then use the features atop the boulder to make an easy mantel.
content.protection: A pair of pads, but the landing is perfect.
content.location: It climbs the north face overhang on the Outback Boulder.
